title: Practice Tool should allow you to do just that.
body: I think Practice Tool is a great way to practice champions. But it shouldn't be just the ones you own. Every other new moba out there lets you try out any champ even if you don't own them AND the skins with it. I think that would help boost profits more as well, since some people won't buy a skin they're unsure about. What do you guys think?

Its practice mode so i agree.

HotS already has this so i'm totally on board with the idea.
Since it's solo player mode only, there's no value in trying skins you don't own without showing it off to other people. In both cases, seeing what you're buying (champion or a skin) and trying it out before the purchase seems more valuable when it comes to our satisfaction as players.
So does DotA

I played HotS as an alternative to League and original DotA.
Not DotA 2. That's why i mentioned HotS only. But it's good that more games follow the same design paradigm as that makes it all the more likely League will get the same features.

In any case, Riot only implemented bare-bones Practice Tool because they didn't have resources available because of the LCU that's almost coming to an end. When the Legacy client finally retires, i bet Riot's going to focus on client features we all request - like Custom Item Sets.

Riot won't let practise be multiplayer as they don't want people looking at the outgoing and incoming data that would have to be trasmitted between both computers and the servers which has the ability to change the game as drastically as giving levels or 10000 gold or reseting cooldowns.

Once you know what commands to send the server in order to execute them in practice mode it wouldn't be hard to reverse engineer them for the live client.

However this is only afaik.  I could be completely wrong about this as I'm too lazy to go back and find their statements concerning this topic.
